alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 3:53PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Somerset and east central Franklin Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 353 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kingfield, or 21 miles north of Farmington, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingfield, Bingham, Carrabassett Valley, Embden, Concord, Solon, Moscow, Lexington, Pleasant Ridge Plantation, Highland Plantation, Salem, Freeman, New Portland and Mount Abram. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for western and west central Maine.

area.areaDesc: Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Southern Somerset
